clinical_study.brief_title: Pain and Placebo Analgesia. Does Extended Information About Dental Procedures Reduce Pain Induced by Dental Treatment?
clinical_study.official_title: Pain and Placebo Analgesia. A Double Blinded, Randomized, Clinical Study About the Impact of Information About Anesthesia, and the Experience of Pain and Stress During Dental Treatment.

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: Information about the effectiveness of treatment has been found to reduce pain, termed placebo analgesia. In this study it will be investigated whether this finding translates to the dental clinic. It will be investigated whether information that suggested that minimal pain will be experienced during filling therapy, can reduce the pain associated with that procedure compared to a group that receives standard information. All patients will receive the same amount of anesthesia and similar procedures during filling therapy. It is predicted that extended information should reduce pain, and that the reduction in pain should be associated with a reduction in stress.

primary_outcome.description: Pain intensity and pain discomfort will be measured by a VAS (Visual Analog Scale). The patients will report their experience of these factors verbally, four times during the treatment session.

secondary_outcome.description: Stress is also measured using the VAS, i.e. using the same method as for pain. Stress or sympathetic activation is measured by using scin conductance on fingers (V-Amp (Brain Products, Munich, Germany).

arm_group.description: This group is given anesthetics and standard information before dental treatment about the anesthetics.
This group is given anesthetics and extended information before dental treatment about the anesthetics.

intervention.intervention_name: anesthetics and extended information before dental treatment
intervention.description: The extended information is a comprehensive explanation about what to expect of the treatment and the anesthetic method, phrased in positive words and opening up for questions after information is given.

intervention.intervention_name: anesthetics and standard information before dental treatment
intervention.description: The standard information is short and concise, telling in neutral words what to expect.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients to be treated for dental caries
- Patients should be able to read and communicate in Norwegian
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with life threatening diseases
- Patients taking pain killers for other reasons on the day of treatment
